comments: Cases were reported from Village Gayatri Nagar in Visakhapatnam Urban. Patients had loose stools and vomiting. Stool samples showed no pathogenic growth, but three water samples were unsafe. District RRT investigated and provided symptomatic treatment. Community awareness sessions on hygiene and sanitation were conducted.

Outbreak occurred in Village Rosekandi Grant, Silchar subdivision. Patients presented with fever. Blood tests were negative for malaria. District RRT investigated and treated cases symptomatically. Awareness on vector control, hygiene, and sanitation was provided.

Cases were reported from Village Uttar Kanchanpur, Algapur subdivision. Patients had fever. One blood sample tested positive for malaria (Plasmodium vivax). RRT investigated, cases treated symptomatically, and community educated on hygiene and vector control.

Outbreak in Talap town, Doom Dooma subdivision. Patients had fever, jaundice, and loss of appetite. Seven samples tested positive for Leptospirosis IgM. Samples were negative for Hepatitis A and E. RRT investigated and provided symptomatic treatment. Health education focused on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Deodaha, Dhanarua subdivision. Patients had diarrhea and vomiting. Stool samples were negative for pathogens. District RRT investigated and cases were treated symptomatically. Awareness on hygiene and sanitation provided to the community.

Outbreak in Village Atapur, Hasanpur subdivision. Patients aged 4â€“30 years had fever with rash. Blood samples tested negative for measles IgM. RRT investigated and treated cases symptomatically. Community educated on vaccination, hygiene, and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Karmadih, Baloda Bazar subdivision. Patients had diarrhea and vomiting. Contaminated water suspected as the cause. District RRT investigated, treated symptomatically, and spread awareness on hygiene and sanitation.

Outbreak occurred in Villages Bendri and Dhaura Bhata, Bhatapara subdivision. Patients had diarrhea and vomiting. Contaminated water suspected. District RRT investigated and cases treated symptomatically. Awareness on control measures and sanitation was given.

Cases reported from Pamgarh subdivision. Patients had diarrhea and vomiting. Stool samples tested negative for pathogens. District RRT investigated, provided symptomatic treatment, and gave community education on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Kuthur, Nawagarh subdivision. Patients had loose stools and vomiting. Stool samples were negative for pathogens. District RRT investigated. Symptomatic treatment and health education on sanitation were provided.

Cases reported from Lakhanpur subdivision. Patients presented with fever, headache, and body pain. Five out of 12 blood samples tested positive for dengue NS1 antigen. RRT investigated, provided treatment, and gave community awareness on mosquito control.

Cases reported from Mainpat subdivision after consumption of food at a community event. Symptoms included abdominal pain, vomiting, and diarrhea. RRT investigated, treated patients symptomatically, and gave health education on food hygiene.

Cases reported from Village Dharagiri, Vansda subdivision, after eating at a local event. Patients had vomiting and diarrhea. District RRT investigated, treated cases symptomatically, and spread awareness on safe food practices.

Cases occurred in Village Balai, Hathin subdivision, after consuming food at a family function. Symptoms included diarrhea and vomiting. District RRT investigated, treated patients, and provided health education on safe food and water use.

Cases reported from Village Gundmanchar, Handwara subdivision. Patients developed abdominal pain, vomiting, and diarrhea after eating at a local event. District RRT investigated, treated symptomatically, and gave health education on food safety.
